snippet: A Metropolitan Transportation Authority presentation outlined a $106 billion list of possible investments over 20 years, including a need for a successor to the MetroCard.
abstract: Metropolitan Transportation Authority outlines $106 billion list to address core capital needs, stretching from 2015 to 2034; many of the possible investments are of a piece with priorities discussed by Thomas F Prendergast since his confirmation as MTA's chairman in June.
lead_paragraph: A Metropolitan Transportation Authority presentation outlined a $106 billion list of possible investments over 20 years, including a need for a successor to the MetroCard.

headline.main: M.T.A. Plan Envisions a Nicer Status Quo
headline.print_headline: M.T.A. Plan Envisions a Nicer Status Quo
